results.title: Show me English: the appointment [episode 1]
results.creator_credit: Victoria. Ministry of Education, David Ferris, Trevor Lunn and Graeme Rowland
results.brief_description: A series of programmes which aim to help adult migrants communicate in everyday situations. Tina makes arrangements to visit her son’s teacher to discuss his progress. Home tutor program by the Adult Migrant Information Service.

results.creator_credit: Victoria. Ministry of Education, David Ferris, Trevor Lunn and Jeff Spencer
results.brief_description: A series of programmes which aim to help adult migrants communicate in everyday situations. Tina swaps her sons jeans for another size. Home tutor program by the Adult Migrant Information Service.

results.title: Show me English: enrolling in class [episode 8]
results.creator_credit: Victoria. Ministry of Education, David Ferris, Trevor Lunn and Jeff Spencer
results.brief_description: A series of programmes which aim to help adult migrants communicate in everyday situations. Tina decides to enrol in English classes following a successful association with Sue, her home tutor. Home tutor program by the Adult Migrant Information Service.

results.title: Show me English: a visit to the doctor [episode 5]
results.creator_credit: Victoria. Ministry of Education, David Ferris, Trevor Lunn and Jeff Spencer
results.brief_description: A series of programmes which aim to help adult migrants communicate in everyday situations. On the second visit to the doctor, Tina is given the result of her test and is prescribed medication and given advice on the importance of diet and rest. Home tutor program by the Adult Migrant Information Service.

results.title: Show me English: a visit to hospital [episode 4]
results.creator_credit: Victoria. Ministry of Education, David Ferris, Trevor Lunn and Jeff Spencer
results.brief_description: A series of programmes which aim to help adult migrants to communicate in everyday situations. The receptionist at a large hospital gives directions to Tina on how to find the Pathology Department. Home tutor program by the Adult Migrant Information Service.

results.title: Show girls
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Tamara Lynch, David Verrall, Barrie Angus McLean and Meilan Lam
results.brief_description: ‘Show Girls’ celebrates Montreal’s swinging Black jazz scene from the 1920’s to the 1960’s, when the city was wide open. Three women who danced in the legendary Black clubs of the day - Rockhead’s Paradise, The Terminal, Cafe St. Michel - share their unforgettable memories of life at the center of one of the world’s hottest jazz spots. From the Roaring Twenties, through the Second World War, and on into the golden era of clubs in the fifties and sixties, ‘Show Girls’ chronicles the lives of Bernice, Tina and Olga, mixing their memories with rarely seen footage of the era. Their stories are told against a backdrop of the fascinating social and political history that made Montreal a jazz and nightclub hotspot for decades. It is a story of song and dance, music and pride. (Award: Yorkton.) Narrated by Anthony Sherwood.

results.title: Show business
results.creator_credit: RKO Radio Pictures, Eddie Cantor and Edwin Marin
results.brief_description: Show business follows the fortunes of a small group of stage folk from 1914 to 1929 and is based on incidents from Eddie Cantor’s life. Features scenes from a variety of performers including minstrel shows, vaudeville, Grand Opera and Ziegfeld Follies. Songs include “You may not remenber me”, “It had to be you” and “Whoopee” Cast includes Eddie Cantor, Joan Davis, George Murphy and Constance Moore. Story by Bert Granet.

results.title: Show Boat
results.creator_credit: Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, Arthur Freed and George Sidney
results.brief_description: The 1951 MGM film of the great stage musical, based on the 1926 novel by Edna Ferber, is a charming, beautiful entertainment with an endearing cast, including Kathryn Grayson as Magnolia, Howard Keel as the gambler, Gaylord Ravenal, and Ava Gardner, nominated for an Academy Award, as the tragic Julie Laverne.

results.title: Shout! the story of Johnny O'keefe
results.brief_description: Johnny O’Keefe, the man who almost single-handedly created the Australian rock`n’roll industry. The man who challenged the Americans and broke all the rules, and whose reward was the devotion of millions of fans for a generation. This is the true story - all the triumphs and all the tears that drove the man forward and ultimately to his tragic, untimely death in 1978. A must for everyone who was there.

results.title: Shout it out numbers
results.brief_description: Uses animated geometric shapes and music to illustrate numbers from one to ten. Triangles, circles, and squares transform into animals, trains, suns, see-saws and other familiar objects.
